p: Combined with the above three parameters ( α, σ, κ), we obtain the ZT values shown in Fig. 3d. The ZT values, which are less than 0.2 for all the samples below 700 K, rapidly increase with the increase of the temperature. At 814 K the ZT value reaches 0.55 for the sample at x = 0.15. This value is about 1.8 times that of the pristine AgInTe 2 with no heat treated.
